Entries.default: "Lash esagan kikiwa." He smiles, his eyes bright.
"Ked tet’elahiza." He gives you a respectful nod.
"Here you are." He grins broadly.
"My friend, hello!" He gives you an excited little wave, then flushes, embarrassed.
"Hasongo… Yiz mah sizaga yah. T’ese?"
"Ask, please." He gives you a slight nod and smiles.
"You learned Aedyran quickly."
"How do you like the Deadfire?"
"What were you planning to do out here?"
"Tell me about your home. Where are you from?"
"You speak to Yiz. To God."
"You ready? ...Lash kigun ginukis gawu?" He claps you on the shoulder. You feel a slight tremor in his hand, but his face is bright and smiling.
"You are... happy with him? Tekēhu?" He casts a quick look in Tekēhu's direction, then glances quickly away, his lips pursed.
"What do you miss about your home?"
"How are you holding up?"
"A funny question. How to explain..." He scrunches up his nose, bunching his freckles.
"Will you go back to Yezuha?"
"Is that possible? I will go now!"
"Ah, we came to teach." He grins. His tense shoulders fall, relieved to no longer be discussing the ship wreck.
"You were going to 'teach' in a place you'd never been to people who don't speak your language?"
"Teach about God." He bounces back on his heels.
"The edge of your map." He tries to stifle a playful grin and fails.
"I wanted to ask you something else."
"Should it be a challenge?" He looks at you quizzically, head tilted to the side. Genuine amusement wrinkles his brow.
"It is hot. And wet. I hate it." He looks about him for something to kick - then, thinking better of it, he crosses his arms and grunts instead.
"I do not. But it is better with you." The scar across his mouth pulls his lips into a little quirk of smile.
"Lash ked yikigi kisid?!" He gestures emphatically to his hair, which is a tangled mess.
"E yeliza mida seliki yeheb?" He slaps at a bug on his arm and frowns deeply.
"You mean 'gods.' It’s plural."
"No. Only God, ta? Eh, how to explain…" His eyes take on a distant look, and his cracks his knuckles absently. Finally, he shrugs.
"What do you think about our traveling companions?"
"My feet hurt."
"Ke tahun gisam ma…" He trails off, not quite looking you in the eye.
"I feel like I wander another’s dream."
"Who?"
"Aloth."
"Edér."
"Maia."
"Pallegina."
"Serafen."
"Tekēhu."
"Xoti."
"The others."
"Who?"
"Konstanten."
"Fassina."
"Ydwin."
"Back to the others."
"Fine, yes." He shrugs.
"Ergh. Creepy!" A little shiver thrills up his spine, and he blanches.
"I offered her a candied nut and she took them all!"
"He puts fire kelp in my soup when he thinks I am not looking."
"Always he has a sour lemon face. Like an old man."
"I want to mess his hair. It is too… tidy."
"Never mind."
"Edér told me God stepped on your house. Your luck is maybe worse than mine." A sly grin spreads across his face.
"From Edér I have learned all the names of animals and names of your drugs."
"Her bird is mean. You see where he bit me? ...I like him." He shows you a shallow, triangle-shaped cut on his forearm and beams.
"I tried to play a trick on her. But she is very fast, and threw me in the sea."

"She reminds me of my old teacher. Do you think she would spar with me?"

He puts a freckled knuckle to his lips, considering.
"Where did he learn Aedyran? Not… here, ta?"
"He threw a blanket at my head. How did he know I was cold?" He looks around quickly.
"Tekēhu showed me rice wine. Blegh, it is terrible!" He screws his face up into an expression of intense disgust.
"He is so noisy!"
"She poked me with her weapon once. She apologized for a week."

"She is good at braids. She put Ishi's feathers in my hair, see?"

He shakes his hair our for you to see. It shines copper-bright, and you spy a few silky red and blue feathers braided into its length.
"That's all for now."
"What, no more?" He pokes you playfully in the arm.
"Later, then."
"Hun gu." He gives you a sharp nod of goodbye.
"Edér taught me Vailian curses. Want to hear?"
"But he will not share either of them." He frowns.
"Ah, but maybe no more when Pallegina is near. She is like... suheki shul aki has. Horse in small house. Very grumpy."
"Lipasalis, my home - it is a big city, ta?" He spreads his arms wide and grins.

"Many people speak many languages. That is… nuyin. Normal."

A sly smile pulls are the corner of his mouth. Whether he's being entirely serious isn't immediately clear.
"How'd your ship sink?"
"There was a storm. Clouds black like night and high as the stars."

"We thought God would protect us."

His hands, usually restless and expressive, hang still at his sides.
"Where were you headed?"
"West." He gestures vaguely toward the horizon, frowning.
"That's enough for now."
"As you say." He shrugs.
"Teach... what, exactly?"
"I am a fast learner."
"You don't seem like a teacher."
"Do I not?"

"I jest. You are right, I am not a teacher. There was a... sehaj. And then I was put on the ship.

"We can discuss, ah, later."
"Do you think my Aedyran is very bad? It cannot be as bad as Serafen's. He opens his mouth and nonsense comes out."
"I did not say I am a good teacher. You learn Seki, maybe we talk more about God." He laughs.
"So you're a missionary, like Xoti."
"I do not know what 'missionary' is, but okay." His eyes take on a distant look, and his cracks his knuckles absently. Finally, he shrugs.
"What did you do back home?"
"I did nothing. That is how I was put on that ship."

"Maybe a building went on fire. Maybe many buildings. But that is the past. The future is more interesting, ta?"

He rubs at the back of his neck, an embarrassed flush coloring his ears.
"Where are your horses?" He narrows his eyes. His tone suggests this is a question that's troubled him for some time.
"A joke from Maia. Home... home is Yezuha. Beyond the storm. Somewhere."
"I miss the wind. Hot and dry, it comes from the mountains, shakes the doors, covers Lipasalis in dust…"
"And the desert. It is beyond the mountains, red and wide. I still smell it sometimes."
"The storms are gone. I could go. Are you offering to take me?" He arches a brow.
"Someday, Yiz hun skiku. But there is still much to see here, I think."
"Are you far from your home, Watcher?"
"I am, and I miss it."
"My home is the open road."
"The Deadfire is my home, and I can't wait to leave it behind."
"I'm from the Deadfire, actually, and it's good to be home."
[Shrug.]
"We are homesick together, then."
"So, you are always at home. I wish I shared your feeling." He nods, and a curtain of hair falls across his face. He pushes it behind his ear with a heavy sigh.
"It is a terrible place, yes." He gives you a pained smile and looks away.
"I am jealous. I do not like it here." He cants his head to the side and smiles to hide the strength of feeling beneath his words.
"If I challenge you to arm wrestling and I win, will you tell me?" He plants his hands on his hips and stands straight, grinning broadly.
"I must find a comb." He points at the mess of his hair.
"Sure."
"No thanks."
"Bazzo! Nasenale! Merla! ...I like that one."
"Eh, fine."
"I poked her with mine and now we are even."
"But there are peppers much spicier in Yezuha. I will get him back."
"Ta."
"Liyezuha igeyi." He turns his hands palm up and gestures forward, sending you off.
"She is like my sister."
"Can I ask you a question?"
"Sure."
"Not right now."
"We talk about the others. What do you think of ME?" Though he smiles in his usual playful way, a dark flush of concern climbs his throat.
"You're fun."
"You're useful."
"You don't get in the way. That's all I care about."
"You're a pain in the ass."
"Fine." He shrugs a shoulder with poorly feigned nonchalance.
"I don't like you."
"I don't have an opinion on you."
"You will in time, eh?" He waggles his eyebrows, a little smile teasing at the corners of his mouth.
"Yukag? Take me home, and I will show you fun." He winks.
"Oh, Watcher! I am so grateful!" He fakes a dramatic swoon, hand held to his chest and eyelashes fluttering, then breaks off the gag with a laugh.
"I hope you praise your lovers with better words." He rolls his eyes.
"You are not the first to say so." He smiles and shrugs.
"Ah, so cruel!" He doubles over, pretending to have been stabbed, then breaks off the gag with a laugh and a wave.
"Ta, I jest. I would not want to make you look bad in front of your friends."
"No one has ever been west. Because of the storms, ta? But we were determined."
"High praise. I am honored." He rolls his eyes.
"I must be faster."
"You are out of rice wine, by the way."
"Hm, but maybe I have enough scars."

"Maybe you close the door next time?"

He folds his arms over his chest with a huff, a pout just turning the edges of his mouth.
"He can hold his breath for a very long time, did you know?"
"...But I cannot fault your taste."
"It is remarkable."
"Home... home is Yezuha. Beyond the storm. Somewhere." Brows drawn, he gestures at the horizon.
"Lash esagan kikiwa." He smiles, his eyes bright.
"Ked tet’elahiza." He gives you a respectful nod.
"Hasongo… Yiz mah sizaga yah. T’ese?"
"You ready? ...Lash kigun ginukis gawu?" He claps you on the shoulder. You feel a slight tremor in his hand, but his face is bright and smiling.
"Ked tet’elahiza." He gives you a respectful nod.
[Give strange tablet to Rekke.] "I found something written in a language I don't know. Do you recognize it?"
"Ku?" He gingerly takes the tablet from you and unwraps the leather cover. His eyebrows shoot up in astonishment.
"This is in Seki - my language! I can read this!" He bounces on his heels, excited.
"Don't keep me in suspense! What's it say?"
[Wait.]
His eyes brighten as they scan the text. When he reaches the bottom, he bursts into delighted laughter.
"Ah, this is a treasure. You have found a very sacred document, Watcher."
"A moment, please. Let me read." He shoos you off with a wave of his hand.

"[Rekke bursts into delighted laughter]"

ACTOR LAUGHS. DO NOT LOCALIZE.

apply wav file to node 190
"Prince of the Heavens shall be fed only young grasses grown on the hills of Lipasalis. He shall be curried morning and night with a brush made of the bristles of boars fed on golden root..."
"This is about a horse, isn't it."
"That doesn't sound like a sacred document to me..."
"Here, I will read some in your Aedyran." He clears his throat and straightens his shoulders, standing with a bit more formality than before.
"Ah, you read many holy texts from Yezuha, then?" Though he tries to keep a straight face, he can't suppress a tiny, teasing smile.
"Wow, that's... really something."
[Raise an eyebrow in question.]
"It is a bill of sale for a horse, in truth. A very special horse." He bites his lip to stop from grinning.
"I tease."
"You would malign my faith, Watcher?" Though he tries to keep a straight face, he can't suppress a tiny, teasing smile.
"You want I should read the rest?"
"Please, be my guest."
"That's enough, thank you."
"You are no fun at all!" He gives you a playful punch in the arm and a bright, teasing smile.

"He shall be given to only the handsomest of mares of the most feisty temperament, for he grows bored unless challenged. And when he is sad, he shall have in his ear whispered only the sweetest praise."
"There is more, but that was the best part." A sly grins spreads slowly across his face.
"Hold on, I'm still coming to terms with that fact that I've been carrying around a huge rock about a horse."
He laughs. "You come to Lipasalis, I will get you many more. You can start a collection."

His eyes flit away from yours and he hesitates, for a moment unsure if this is a topic he wants to discuss.

Then he takes a death breath, purses his lips, and meets your eyes again, this time with intent.
He quiets a moment, blinking rapidly. But when he looks at you next, he's smiling his usual, carefree smile.
It seems as if a heavy weight settles on his shoulders, but he gives you a thin, pained smile and shrugs his longing off with practiced ease.
Spying Serafen nearby, he narrows his eyes and watches him with a look of deep suspicion... and curiosity.
He wiggles his fingers in Aloth's direction and laughs.
As you turn away, you feel a slight tug on your sleeve. When you look back, you find Rekke watching you with one eyebrow raised and the start of a mischievous grin on his lips.
